title: Primera División de México Apertura 2007
text:
<a href="Primera%20Divisi%C3%B3n%20de%20M%C3%A9xico">Primera División de México</a> "(Mexican First Division)" Apertura 2007 is a Mexican <a href="football%20%28soccer%29">football</a> tournament - one of two shorter tournaments that together make up the Mexican football season - to determine the champion(s) of Mexican football. It began on Friday, August 3, 2007. On June 10, 2007, <a href="Federaci%C3%B3n%20Mexicana%20de%20F%C3%BAtbol%20Asociaci%C3%B3n">FMF</a> General Secretary Decio de Maria revealed the groups for the upcoming tournament. Reigning champions <a href="C.F.%20Pachuca">Pachuca</a> were eliminated in Repechaje by <a href="Cruz%20Azul">Cruz Azul</a> by a double leg aggragate score of 6-0 (0-2 in the first leg, 4-0 in the second leg) and thus could not retain their title. <a href="Puebla%20F.C.">Puebla</a> was promoted to the <a href="Primera%20Divisi%C3%B3n%20de%20M%C3%A9xico">Primera División de México</a> after they beat <a href="Dorados%20de%20Sinaloa">Sinaloa</a> in the ascension final thus, <a href="Quer%C3%A9taro%20FC">Querétaro</a> was relegated to the <a href="Primera%20Divisi%C3%B3n%20A">Primera División A</a>. This is the first time they are taking part in a Primera División tournament since they were relegated after <a href="2005%20Primera%20Divisi%C3%B3n%20de%20M%C3%A9xico%20Clausura">Clausura 2005</a>. <a href="Atlante%20F.C.">Atlante</a> made the move to Cancún, Quintana Roo, and played in the <a href="Estadio%20Andr%C3%A9s%20Quintana%20Roo">Estadio Andrés Quintana Roo</a> after having played in <a href="Estadio%20Azteca">Estádio Azteca</a> for over a decade. At their new home, on December 9, 2007 Atlante won the Apertura 2007 by defeating UNAM 2–1 on aggregate. It was Atlante's third title.

By winning Apertura 2007, Atlante earned a quarterfinal spot in the <a href="2008%20CONCACAF%20Champions%27%20Cup">2008 CONCACAF Champions' Cup</a>, along with a berth in the <a href="2008%E2%80%9309%20CONCACAF%20Champions%20League">2008–09 CONCACAF Champions League</a> <a href="2008%E2%80%9309%20CONCACAF%20Champions%20League%23Group%20stage">Group Stage</a>.
By being the Apertura 2007 runner-up, the Pumas earned a berth in the <a href="2008%E2%80%9309%20CONCACAF%20Champions%20League">2008–09 CONCACAF Champions League</a> <a href="2008%E2%80%9309%20CONCACAF%20Champions%20League%23Preliminary%20round">Preliminary Round</a>.
